entries.meaning: Service that results in harm; an (intentionally or unintentionally) unhelpful, harmful action.
examples: One renders young people a disservice by heaping unearned rewards on them.

verbs.description: disservice (third-person singular simple present disservices, present participle disservicing, simple past and past participle disserviced)

entries.meaning: To disserve, to provide a disservice to; to provide harmful or inadequate service to.
